title: Jerusalem’s Destruction and Exile
summary: Babylon destroys Jerusalem after Zedekiah’s rebellion. The temple and city walls are torn down, and most of the people are taken into exile. Zedekiah is captured and blinded. The book ends with the hope of Jehoiachin’s release from prison years later.

faq.question: What happened to Jerusalem?
faq.answer: It was burned and destroyed by Babylon, and most people were exiled.

faq.question: How does the book end?
faq.answer: With Jehoiachin’s release from prison in Babylon, offering a small sign of hope.
